results.content:
Whilst the course eventually covers everything, it is too fast to actually learn anything without pausing every few seconds.

The constant background music is incredibly irritating and distracting for me.

I abandoned the course during the second module, so for me it was a waste of money.  I know Angular and Angular Fire/Firebase well so I was learning nothing new.  I bought the course because I wanted to learn how to combine my existing knowledge with Ionic but the approach didn't help me with that.  The course tells you what to do and commendably does encourage good practices, but it IMHO it doesn't really teach anything.  I seriously doubt any newbie would benefit from the course unless they happened to notice modules 8 and later where you can learn some of the background material needed.

I seriously doubt any newbie would benefit from the course unless they happened to notice modules 8 and later where you can learn some of the background material needed.

results.content: Perfect timing, explanations, examples and references. Would love some scope scaling though, difficult to see when he is typing.

results.content: excellent, but the first time I tried the course I was too inexperienced - so definitely for really advanced Ionic developers

results.content:
The course is really useful - it goes more deeply into good practice and use cases rather than just spouting information that can be gleaned from the docs.
I also like the rapid pace and the presentational approach.
results.content_html:
The course is really useful - it goes more deeply into good practice and use cases rather than just spouting information that can be gleaned from the docs.
I also like the rapid pace and the presentational approach.

results.content:
Impossible to watch on the iPad - would be improved by zooming in on the active part of the editor while typing - 50% of the screen is irrelevant. Color scheme makes it difficult to read (particularly the red text).

HIGHLY DISTRACTING BACK GROUND MUSIC. Makes it very hard to concentrate on the content. The "music" serves no purpose and detracts from learning. Once you've noticed the music you can't un-notice it - removing that from this course would be a massive improvement.

Details are glossed over at high speed. I don't think you can learn anything in detail from this course, but if you are just looking for a starter to point you in a direction for what is possible then it's okay.

results.content: The screens are scrolling too fast. Difficult to keep pace when typing everything. Hoping things improve and slow down later.
results.content_html: The screens are scrolling too fast. Difficult to keep pace when typing everything. Hoping things improve and slow down later.

results.content: The whole course does not have a single line of code, everything is pre-recorded and it seems that the lecturer recorded the voice with voiceover, there is no explanation of lines, there is the code on the screen that ran and the instructor meanwhile from the announcer, I did not like.

response.content: Hi Shay. This is an interesting review. It's unfortunate that you never reached out before requesting a refund and posting this review, because we could have worked through it together. To answer your points, every line of code in this course is available in the repo, and downloadable files are available where they'll help. Explanations, often in extensive form, are given throughout the entire course. ~All lines are walked through, and where they aren't it's because it's not as important as the other stuff. With such a course there is a constant question of what to explain and what not to explain. Thus expecting absolutely everything to be explained is unrealistic and will almost certainly bore everyone to death. The course description makes it clear that this is a fast-moving, dense course about getting You on your feet. It also mentions that I'm available for questions should you become stuck or otherwise. And about the voiceover, how else are tutorials made? Perfect sync and 100% line-for-line walkthroughs: this is not a strategy very conducive to learning.
